definition[0]: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way
example[1]: Civil rights groups pleaded for government help.
example[2]: Moira pleaded with him to stay.
definition[1]: to state in a court of law whether or not you are guilty of a crime
definition[2]: to give reasons why you think something is true or why something should be done
example[4]: Residents successfully pleaded their case at a council meeting.
example[5]: Managers pleaded that there was not enough time to make the changes.
definition[3]: to state in a court of law whether you are guilty of a crime or not
example[6]: Charged with fraud for selling the fakes, they agreed to plead guilty (=to admit that they did the crime).
example[7]: He pleaded no contest to (=said that he would not defend himself against) two assault charges and resigned his office in disgrace.
